ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot more about paying close attention to my work during the editing process, and learning to focus on the "whataboutism" of a piece.
I developed my creative writing skills and learned about various different writing techniques across many genres.
I developed a closer understanding of the concept of genre and how it can be manipulated in writing.
I improved my writing ability, especially in genres I had never had exposure to before.
I learned how to write in mediums which I had never done before. Great exploration.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course fostered a great sense of camaraderie - but watch out for a disorganised prof!
The strength of this course was the closeness of my class  we all gave great feedback and I really enjoyed all of our workshops.

The biggest weakness in the course was its structure, which is bound to happen with a new course. I think the course should be restructured to have more small assignments instead of a few large assignments. Other than that, the course was great. I liked my classmates, the reading material, and the discussions and workshops.

Professor Zarin is a great instructor. The variety of the assignments kept the class engaging throughout, and the other students in the course were really wonderful. I think our discussions of the readings took a bit too much time from our workshops.
this course was really disorganized and rushed. in future iterations, it would be great if there was a more consistent syllabus and timeline.
Its a great class that will only get better with time.

This was Profesor Zarins first time teaching this class, and I really enjoyed the format! I think one thing that can be improved that we already discussed is time allocated to workshopping, as these sometimes felt a bit rushed.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if you don't mind a stressful lack of syllabus and are looking to improve your creative writing in every way.
I would recommend this course to any student interested in developing their creative writing skills.
If you are passionate about writing at any level and in any subject, yes.

Yes! This class was really fun. I would recommend taking it (even for those who aren't English majors!). Challenging myself to write creatively across all of the genres taught me a lot about writing, and the collaborative nature of the class really helped me improve.

the strength of the course was the relationships we built among the students over the course of the semester. by the end we all really knew and understood each others' styles and goals and it really helped us facilitate each others' writing. the biggest weakness, again, was the lack of organization and how rushed it was.
